newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Soy shipping conditions at key Brazilian ports.
newsitem.headline: Soy shipping conditions at key Brazilian ports.

text.p: Key Brazilian ports reported the following conditions for shipments of soybeans and soy products:

Vessels: Ocean Lady loading 47,000 tonnes soymeal. Lepetane loading 22,000 tonnes soymeal. Flag Supplier loading 54,200 tonnes soybeans. Sun P loading 55,000 tonnes soybeans. Humber loading 55,000 tonnes soybeans/meal.
Trucks: A total 2,124 trucks arrived on March 31, a new record for the port. Of this, 1,677 trucks unloaded soybeans, 348 soymeal and 99 trucks vegetable oils including soyoil.

NOTE: Loading of grains at the port's export terminal was suspended at 0750 local/1050 GMT because of rain. The port expects loading to continue sporadically throughout the day insofar as rains allow.
Vessels: Hilon of Sparta loading 55,000 soybeans. Huta Kotowice waiting to load 54,000 tonnes soybeans. Aghia Trias loading 59,126 tonnes soybeans at Cargill private terminal.
Road: 385 trucks arrived on March 31 unloading 9,940 tonnes soybeans and 34 trucks arrived unloading 797 tonnes soymeal.
Rail: 43 wagons arrived unloading 2,005 tonnes soymeal and nine wagons arrived unloading 562 tonnes soymeal.
Loading: In the month of March, the port terminal loaded 138,094 tonnes soybeans and 15,001 tonnes soymeal. The Cargill private terminal loaded 70,196 tonnes soybeans and 32,723 tonnes soymeal.
NOTE: Loading of grains at the port's export terminal was suspended because of rain at 1730 local Monday. Facilities remained shut Tuesday morning.

Vessels: China Spirit to start loading 30,000 tonnes soymeal. Boris Livanov expected April 2, to load 19,000 tonnes soybeans. Dunga Saga Satu expected April 6, to load a total of 45,000 soymeal at two separate private terminals. Ariston expected April 8, to load 12,000 tonnes soyoil. NOTE: The port, which was recently privatised, does not release any information on arrivals and stock levels.
